B

BoardHeight() - Static method in class TicTacToe
Asks user input for the height of the gameboard.

C

CheckWins() - Static method in class TicTacToe
Checks if the marks placed by the user/computer form a horizontal, vertical or a diagonal line, containing an equal amount of that player's marks to the user defined amount of marks required to win the game.

F

FullBoard() - Static method in class TicTacToe
Checks if the board is full or not.

Starts the game and keeps it running until a winner is found or the gameboard is full.

N

NewGame() - Static method in class TicTacToe
Prints out the rules for the game and then starts the adjustments for the gameboard size, starting by asking an input for the width of the gameboard.
numBoard(int) - Static method in class Validate
This loop checks the user input for the size of the gameboard.
numMark(int, int, int) - Static method in class Validate
This loop checks the user input for the marks required to win the game.
numPlay(int, int) - Static method in class Validate
This loop checks the user input values for the coordinates for the human player's mark.

P

PlayGame() - Static method in class TicTacToe
Runs the methods for the player turn and the computer turn.
PrintNewGameboard() - Static method in class TicTacToe
First fills the gameboard with '-' (markEmpty), then prints out the board.
PrintUpdatedGameboard(int, int, int) - Static method in class TicTacToe
Prints the gameboard with the human and the computer player's marks updated in it.

T

TicTacToe - Class in <Unnamed>
TicTacToe - The class performs an ASCII graphic tic-tac-toe game with dynamic gameboard size against an AI player.
TicTacToe() - Constructor for class TicTacToe
 

V

Validate - Class in <Unnamed>
Validate - The class processes user input, depending on the situation, through different methods to validate it to an appropriately sized integer.
